channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: More frustrated prosecutors at the U.S Attorney's office in Minnesota call it quits
item.description: Turmoil continues at the U.S. Attorney's office in Minneapolis. This week another attorney was removed from a special assignment dealing with immigration cases after telling a judge she hates her job.
item.content:encoded: Turmoil continues at the U.S. Attorney's office in Minneapolis. This week another attorney was removed from a special assignment dealing with immigration cases after telling a judge she hates her job.
item.dc:creator: Matt Sepic

item.title: Is a new Iran nuclear deal possible?
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with NPR's Geoff Brumfiel and Greg Myre about the upcoming meeting between Iran and the United States.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with NPR's Geoff Brumfiel and Greg Myre about the upcoming meeting between Iran and the United States.
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: Get ready for the Olympic halfpipe
item.description: To get ready to watch the Winter Olympics, we talk to former Olympian Tricia Byrnes about some snow boarding terminology.
item.content:encoded: To get ready to watch the Winter Olympics, we talk to former Olympian Tricia Byrnes about some snow boarding terminology.
item.dc:creator: Jason Fuller

item.title: Olympic athletes protest big oil
item.description: Several athletes are objecting to the International Olympic Committee over sponsorship of the Games by major oil companies. They say fossil fuel use threatens winter conditions needed for snow sports.
item.content:encoded: Several athletes are objecting to the International Olympic Committee over sponsorship of the Games by major oil companies. They say fossil fuel use threatens winter conditions needed for snow sports.
item.dc:creator: Nathaniel Herz

item.title: What a recent executive order from Trump means for housing costs
item.description: President Trump recently signed an executive order targeting large institutional investors that buy up homes. But in some circumstances, those large investors have led to more housing affordability.
item.content:encoded: President Trump recently signed an executive order targeting large institutional investors that buy up homes. But in some circumstances, those large investors have led to more housing affordability.
item.dc:creator: Nick Fountain

item.title: Plastic surgeons say transgender youth should wait until age 19 for surgery
item.description: The American Society of Plastic Surgeons says transgender youth should wait until age 19 to have any surgeries. Surgery is already rarely performed for transgender young people.
item.content:encoded: The American Society of Plastic Surgeons says transgender youth should wait until age 19 to have any surgeries. Surgery is already rarely performed for transgender young people.
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: Father James Martin chronicles the meandering path that brought him to the priesthood
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with Father James Martin about his new book Work in Progress: Confessions of a busboy, dishwasher, caddy, usher, factory worker, bank teller, corporate tool, and priest.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with Father James Martin about his new book Work in Progress: Confessions of a busboy, dishwasher, caddy, usher, factory worker, bank teller, corporate tool, and priest.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Can't solve a puzzle? Sleep on it, a new study suggests
item.description: NPR's Short Wave talks about babies' perceptions of rhythm, how sleep may help us solve puzzles and why snakes may be able to fast so long.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Short Wave talks about babies' perceptions of rhythm, how sleep may help us solve puzzles and why snakes may be able to fast so long.
item.dc:creator: Regina G. Barber

item.title: Metal band Megadeth and Harry Styles each hit No. 1 this week on the Billboard Charts
item.description: NPR Music's Stephen Thompson reports on new music shaping the charts.
item.content:encoded: NPR Music's Stephen Thompson reports on new music shaping the charts.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Thompson

item.title: A 'Jane Doe' in the R. Kelly trials is ready to share her real name. And her story
item.description: A once anonymous R. Kelly survivor, Reshona Landfair is now ready to reclaim her voice.
item.content:encoded:
A once anonymous R. Kelly survivor, Reshona Landfair is now ready to reclaim her voice.

(Image credit: Grand Central Publishing)
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers
